title: Diagnostic for missing method `as_ptr_mut` does not mention `as_mut_ptr`

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
[Given the following code](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=c5f1905e3e5f02a3e4b974a77a107e30): 

```rust
fn main() {
    let mut v = vec![1,2,3];
    v.as_ptr_mut();
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0599]: no method named `as_ptr_mut` found for struct `Vec<{integer}>` in the current scope
 --> src/main.rs:3:7
  |
3 |     v.as_ptr_mut();
  |       ^^^^^^^^^^ help: there is an associated function with a similar name: `as_ptr`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
```
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0599]: no method named `as_ptr_mut` found for struct `Vec<{integer}>` in the current scope
 --> src/main.rs:3:7
  |
3 |     v.as_ptr_mut();
  |       ^^^^^^^^^^ help: there is an associated function with a similar name: `as_mut_ptr`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
```

A common pattern is to append `_mut` for functions that return `&mut` references. But the pointer types use a different convention.
